summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 concerning Jeffrey Epstein's detention at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It includes communications between legal staff and MCC personnel regarding Epstein's mental state, a leak of information to the press, and an ongoing investigation into a possible attack on Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the emails; an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. Concerns are raised about his mental health and a possible attack on him.

events.title: Concerns about Epstein's Mental State
events.description: Epstein's parents visited him and described him as nearly incoherent, with his condition noted as being as bad as ever. A legal visit was scheduled for the next morning.

events.title: Press Inquiry About Possible Attack
events.description: A journalist from NBC contacted MCC staff to confirm a story about Epstein being questioned regarding a possible attack on him at the facility.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 26, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein's parents reported he was 'nearly incoherent' and in the worst mental state they had ever seen.
An MCC Supervisory Staff Attorney confirmed an open investigation was ongoing and that staff were reminded not to retaliate against Epstein.
A news leak occurred prior to July 24, 2019, prompting a press inquiry to the MCC about a story on Epstein being questioned about a possible attack.
The email chain indicates coordination between legal representatives and correctional staff regarding Epstein's welfare and case management.
The document is marked as potentially confidential attorney-client communication.
